column4: i half suspect i'd throw together my own varient of ubuntu if i get a netbook ;p. UNR looks kinda toyish, and i think something like openbox and the bare necesities would be nice
I've used "full desktop" Ubuntus on my netbooks, but find the UNR interface to be preferrable on small screens because it is, essentially, just a giant "tasty menu".

I don't usually see my desktop so... i think i'd want something like this ;p https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1111219/Lobotomy%20screenshots/stuff.png (guake, openbox, swiftfox... when everything is closed, its a blank screen unless you rightclick to get the menu open) ;p
I don't think I would feel efficient with that sort of interface.
Pentium M 1.4. no hard drive. 256 mb disk. i used to run kubuntu on it before the hard drive died ;p
I'm talking current hardware only. I'm not counting the old 386-33 that I compiled my first linux kernel for me.
oh, is current. I just run it off a flashdrive now ;p
iirc the livecd uses gparted right?
yes, but it seems to not be as full-featured. Or maybe it just has a more noob-friendly interface.
they really need to have ethernet cabling standard in houses, like power ;p
I ought to invest in a nice -n router, if I could only pick one to buy, since 1/2 of the networkable appliances in the house already have -n cards in them.
well allegedly the fiber internet modems come with an AP. if they do, i can convert my DDWRT to a bridge.

Both of my wireless routers reliably run dd-wrt and are rock solid for me. One handles the house, the other one bridges the main signal into a throttled -b free net for the cul-de-sac. Mostly so I can sit on the lawn in the summer.
i have a WRT54GL (which is what i recommend to people) and a di 524 (which i got free from a client who hated it)
I like the WRT54G series. I have 2 of them myself. I'm considering adding a 610. Its a 610 or a 400.
i hope they have a ipv6 capable version though. It would save me some headache ;p
